means: （从一事物到另一事物的）渐变

sentence.Network_en: Note the subtle gradation of / in colour in this painting.
sentence.Network_cn: 注意这幅画中色彩的细微变化.

sentence.Network_en: It is hard to understand all the minute gradation of their bureaucracy.
sentence.Network_cn: 很难弄清楚他们那套官僚体制全部细微的等级分别.

sentence.Network_en: The fourth way is taken from the gradation to be found in things.
sentence.Network_cn: 第四个论证出自在事物中发现的等级.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... gradient a 步行的 gradation n 等级；层次 gradual a 逐步的.
graben valley 断块谷gradation 分级grade 等级
能没有太多渐层(gradation)；而反差低则指光与暗之间不够明显或不够鲜明，但有较多的层次，看起来可能会使人觉得较呆板。
grab sample 抓斗样本gradation 级配;修坡;均夷作用;粒级作用gradation test 粒径分析

list.abs: gradability 可分等级性gradation period 均夷相gradation zone 渐变带
lateral eruption 侧喷发lateral gradation 侧夷酌lateral inflow 侧面进水

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin gradatio(n-), based on gradus 'step'

entry.def: Gradations are small differences or changes in things.

example.ex: But TV images require subtle gradations of light and shade.
example.tran: 但是，电视影像要求有十分细微的光影变化。

means.word_mean: 1. relative position in a graded series;
3. the act of arranging in grades

auth_sentence.content: One continual gradation of political errors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One continual gradation of political errors.

auth_sentence.content: It needed to be easy and quick to play, require some skill, have gradation for world record separation, and lots of fun.
auth_sentence.res_content: It needed to be easy and quick to play, require some skill, have gradation for world record separation, and lots of fun.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It needed to be easy and quick to play, require some skill, have gradation for world record separation, and lots of fun.

auth_sentence.content: It looks like a gradation or a transition from broad-toothed makos to the modern white shark.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It looks like a gradation or a transition from broad-toothed makos to the modern white shark.
